heading: enshrined
subheading: baseball writers on tuesday sent three greats to the the game's hall of fame: ageless fireballer nolan ryan; sweet-stroking third baseman george brett; and robin yount, who gained stardom despite spending his entire 20-year career in obscurity (milwaukee). no player has ever been ticketed to cooperstown on a unanimous vote, but ryan came close, gaining a 98.79 percent endorsement, second all-time to tom seaver's 98.84 in 1992.
author: wired staff
text: baseball writers on tuesday sent three greats to the the game's hall of fame: ageless fireballer nolan ryan; sweet-stroking third baseman george brett; and robin yount, who gained stardom despite spending his entire 20-year career in obscurity (milwaukee). no player has ever been ticketed to cooperstown on a unanimous vote, but ryan came close, gaining a 98.79 percent endorsement, second all-time to tom seaver's 98.84 in 1992.
